page.title: 08Communications in Corby.
page.content: Corby is now Northamptonshire's second largest town. It is some 130 km. north of London and 95 km. east of Birmingham between the M1 and M6 junctions and the A1. A new east-west link, the A1-M1 is proposed and this will further benefit the town which has had all its major roads upgraded in recent years. A new railway station to replace the one closed by the Beeching Act of 1962 is also proposed. At present the nearest mainline station is at Kettering, 11 km south of Corby Within the town there is an adequate bus service run by the United Counties Bus Company using single and double-decker buses. It links the town centre with all the estates and serves several surrounding villages although people complain the rural service is poor. Corby also boasts a large number of London Hackney Cabs as taxis.
